main event: An unidentified flying object was reported over Pensacola Bay on July 15, 1960, with multiple witnesses confirming its presence and subsequent disappearance into the water.
interesting points: The object was described as approximately three feet in diameter and made a sound upon entering the water., An unsuccessful recovery operation was conducted due to the soft muddy bottom of the bay., The object is speculated to be either a meteorite or a part of an artificial satellite., Several aerial sightings were reported around the same time by different military personnel., The duration of the sightings lasted several minutes, with various accounts corroborating the events.
witness description: military personnel and civilians in the area
